14:59 <chaas> Hi. How do I get the ID of the current page? I'd like to add a nav tree to the sidebar that opens up to the current document. $doc? $doc.id()?  
14:59 <chaas> is now known as <Signum>  
15:01 <msmeria> has quit  
15:06 <Signum> oh, wait I got it… {{documentTree showAttachments="false" finder="true" openTo="document:$doc.getDocumentReference()" /}}  
15:06 <vmassol> yep  
15:06 <vmassol> you can check the Panels.Navigation panel which does this  
15:07 <vmassol> ## Escape special characters in macro parameter values.  
15:07 <vmassol> #set ($openToDoc = $doc.documentReference.toString().replaceAll('([~"])', '~$1'))

16:29 <Signum> Hmm, is there a way to re-order pages? I'm writing documentation and am trying to arrange the sub pages in a certain order.  
16:30 <Signum> (7.4.1)  
16:30 <vmassol> you mean in the tree Signum?  
16:30 <Signum> Right.  
16:31 <Signum> The documenttree macro supports moving pages… but the changes do not get saved (the documentation confirms that).  
16:31 <Signum> Or does xwiki not have a notion of order?  
16:32 <vmassol> it seems the order it based on the name or title  
16:32 <vmassol> s/it/is  
16:32 <vmassol> actually name  
16:32 <vmassol> not title  
16:33 <vmassol> and I don't think the document tree maro supports any different ordering  
16:33 <vmassol> \*macro  
16:33 <Signum> Hmm, the page titles are "1. foo", "2. bar" and "3. baz". The order appears to be random like 3/1/2.  
16:34 <vmassol> the screenshots seem to suggest ordering on name but I haven't checked the code  
16:34 <vmassol> it could be simply ordered on when the pages were added to the store  
16:35 <Signum> Bummer.  
16:37 <vmassol> I'm checking source code  
16:37 <Signum> Thanks.  
16:44 <vmassol> Signum: I tracked it to https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/464e4fc1ec7eff8782c86909cb89da575a285a89/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-index/xwiki-platform-index-tree/xwiki-platform-index-tree-macro/src/main/resources/XWiki/DocumentTreeMacros.xml#L416-L416  
16:44 <vmassol> so there's an order defined  
16:45 <vmassol> trying to understand 3, 2 1, refer to  
16:45 <vmassol> maybe the select items  
16:45 <Signum> Sounds like some legacy ordering from <7.1 with spaces and stuff.  
16:45 <vmassol> the macro supports both  
16:46 <Signum> Do you think the order can be overriden by changing variables in the page?  
16:46 <vmassol> errr  
16:46 <vmassol> you just need to change the order by  
16:47 <vmassol> ie the $orderByClause value  
16:47 <Signum> I'm really no xwiki guru. Been using Confluence for a while and otherwise am using other programming languages. :(  
16:47 <vmassol> :)  
16:47 <Signum> Something like that, yes.  
16:47 \* Signum tries to get $orderByClause  
16:48 <vmassol> IMO what you shoud do is create a jira issue  
16:48 <vmassol> explaining your need  
16:48 <vmassol> and the need for the document tree to have some configurable ordering  
16:48 <vmassol> \*document tree macro  
16:49 <Signum> Makes sense. I thought it was a pretty common requirement. Confluence uses a drag'n'drop view of pages in a space, too. But I don't mind being the first one. :)  
16:56 <vmassol> drag and drop is hard because it means a manual ordering  
16:56 <vmassol> and thus you need to save that manual ordering somewhere and keep it up to date with page renames/deletes/etc  
16:57 <vmassol> it would be a nice feature though  
16:57 <vmassol> note that if you need a menu with a defined ordering that's easy to do  
16:58 <vmassol> (with a panel and wiki ilnks inside)  
17:17 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki
